hero.heading: Interior Doors Checklist
hero.copy: Interior doors can blend into your decor or make a statement. When selecting yours, think about what level of privacy you need between rooms and how much space you’ll need for door opening and foot traffic.
hero.direction: How to shop for interior doors

cards.title: Start with the basics.
cards.copy: Not sure where to begin? By the end of this guide you should be able to walk into a store with an idea of what you want.

cards.title: Make your own checklist.
cards.copy: As you’re learning about interior doors, use our checklist to keep track of things you’d like to discuss with a Lowe’s specialist.

cards.title: When you’re ready, talk to us.
cards.copy: We’ve got experts ready to help you in the Doors aisle. We can give you an installation quote while you’re there.

inspiration.heading: Consider going pro.
copy: Skip the hassle of needing to accurately measure your interior door.
You don’t have to worry about accidentally voiding your warranty.
A pro will clean up the mess and dispose of your old door.

outro.heading: If you go DIY, here’s how to measure your interior door.

cards.title: Width
cards.copy: Measure the distance between the edge of one side of the door to the edge of the other side of the door.

cards.title: Height
cards.copy: Next, measure the distance between the top edge of the door to the bottom edge of the door.

cards.title: Depth
cards.copy: Measure the width of the frame, from edge to edge, across the existing door frame. Ignore any door trim.
